website_summaries.verdict: If all you need to do is get that apple cored, this little tool will do the job reliably at a low price.
pros: Strong and easy to hold handle
Works on pears as well as apples
End is sharp, but not dangerous
cons: For some apples the diameter of this corer is not quite wide enough to get the whole core

customer_reviews.title: Does What it Does
customer_reviews.text: If you like stabbing things but don't like to go to jail, buy this. Stab your heart away - not literally, as that would both be difficult and dangerous - with this lil corer. And that probably the first and last time I'll ever write the word "corer". Pretty hard to actually mess this product up, but it's remarkably useful. It cores away regardless of apple size. Sometimes you miss the center and have to try again; sometimes the core is too large and you have to have a 2nd go. Pop the core out with your finger, rinse in the sink, and enjoy your freshly cored apple.
customer_reviews.author: El Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I was tired of cutting the apple away from the core and still having to carve out some of the core. So I thought I would make apple coring easier. I'm disappointed enough where I might just cut the apple again. The diameter of the corer is small so you have to thrust the corer through the apple several times (3-4xs) to get all of the core, and it immediately causes your apple to turn brown from the cutting. I and my son like to eaty fresh apples and the brown make them unappealing.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Crowder

customer_reviews.title: WORKS VERY WELL
customer_reviews.text: If you twist it gently when you make contact with the apple to break the skin it's pretty easy. If you just drive it in with pressure, however, it could lead to an accident. Just gently twist to sort of saw through the skin, then it's easy peezy.
customer_reviews.author: S Graves

customer_reviews.title: Good idea but could be better
customer_reviews.text: The OXO corer is solid, well made and very close to being just right for its intended purpose (i.e. to remove the core of fruit and vegetables). One minor change would do the trick: It needs to be sharpened! In its current design, the device bulls its way through the item leaving bruised content behind. This is an excellent tool and great idea ... but could be better. Review Update: On 5/18/14 I sharpened the corer and uploaded a picture to the product description. My corer now has a sharpened cutting edge that moves through the item very smoothly and reduces browning on cored apples.
customer_reviews.author: Emale

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Device for Lots of Coring!
customer_reviews.text: Love this apple corer! We have an abundance of apples that I needed to peel and core. I've tried messing with the clamp on apple peeler corer gadget, but I couldn't make it work. I decided to look for an alternative and here it is! I can peel super fast but the coring by hand always made my apple pieces too small. With this device all you have to do is stick it in the apple wiggle a little and push down on your cutting board and Voila! Too bad our local Walmart didn't have anything like this. Glad Amazon is there!
customer_reviews.author: MJ South Dakota

customer_reviews.title: Works well, sharp
customer_reviews.text: This works well. I have a corer/slicer but I wanted just a corer from some recipes like baked apple. This onne works well. I have a hard time aligning the core sometimes but it does cut cleanly. Just a little twisting let's me easily cut throught he apple. The size is good. There is little waste. I do get a seed left now and again but I would rager that than lose to much apple. The open side makes removing the core pretty easy.
customer_reviews.author: Waynemia

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I have a toddler who devours apples in what seems to be record time. He doesn’t like sliced apples (he wants them whole like a grown up) so I needed to find an alternative to our Apple slicer. This fit the bill perfectly and I have had really good experiences with all of my oxo products in the past years so I knew it was worth it to try this out. It does the job, no frills and now I don’t have to worry about my son eating the stem and seeds.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Works great, I buy apples just to use this thing
customer_reviews.text: only issue is most apples dont have cores that are perpendicular so sometimes have to guess direction of where to punch out the core. Sometimes I nail it, sometimes I don't. When I don't I flip the apple over, insert the corer and shave off the side that has seeds that I missed
customer_reviews.author: John P.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but a bit dificult to use
customer_reviews.text: I had an older-style corer that finally gave up the ghost after 20+ years. Based on the reviews from America's Test Kitchen, I decided to buy this corer. Although it does a good job, I prefer my older-style corer as this can be difficult for me to get through very firm apples.
customer_reviews.author: classicalgeek

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, well made
customer_reviews.text: This is one of those kitchen gadgets that you don’t think you need until you get one. I’m glad I chose this model instead of the hinged one; it takes less space in the drawer, and sturdier because of no moving parts.
customer_reviews.author: aist

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: My toddler has discovered that she loves eating a whole apple, but she doesn't understand she's not supposed to eat the core. This has been perfect! Nothing fancy, very simple, super easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: So much easier
customer_reviews.text: Love this! Makes apples do much easier to cut up fit my toddler! Most times I just peep them and then use this product to get the core out and my daughter loves to Eat them like that because it makes it easier to hold.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffanie

customer_reviews.title: Makes Coring Apples For Dehydrated Fruit Easy
customer_reviews.text: Mr. MVP and I eat a lot of dehydrated fruit. This apple corer works wonders. I usually have problems with kitchen tools that require upper body strength because I have a medical device in my chest, but I can easily core apple after apple. I line the corer up with the stem and push firmly down until it reaches the cutting board on the other end. Usually I need to push the core out with my finger if it does not slip out with the corer. The whole process takes about 5 to 10 seconds. We don't soak our apples with any lemon or extra chemicals, we just core them, slice them and then toss them in the dehydrator.
customer_reviews.author: NVanPutt

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I haven't owned an apple corer in a while, so this was a nice addition recently. It works very well and is sturdy. The handle is very easy to grasp and while it may not feel sharp to the touch, it does the job well. Since this free floats in a drawer, I actually like that it isn't that sharp. It won't cut anyone who doesn't realize this is free floating. Overall, it does the job and I can't complain.
customer_reviews.author: Paige

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as I had hoped
customer_reviews.text: Not as good as I had hoped it would be. Using it to remove the cores on Granny Smith apples doesn't work nearly as well as I thought it would. You still need to clean up the cores after cutting the apple up. I was hoping it would make cutting the apples easier/faster, but it doesn't improve anything for me. I'm better off cutting them up and using a knife to remove the core sections from each wedge.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little device - cores apples in seconds!
customer_reviews.text: I was very pleasantly surprised with this little gadget - it makes coring apples so much easier! We had been using a paring knife previously, and that not only took forever, but also caused some major cuts. This little guy cores an apple in mere seconds and other than having apple juice squirt back at you there is zero risk of injury! I also love how it doesn't take up any storage space, since it's roughly the size of a vegetable peeler. Overall very happy with this and wish I had bought it sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Olga's Laundry

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected.
customer_reviews.text: I used this product to core apples to make smoothies. I used to use knives to cut the apples and remove the cores. This product makes it much easier to remove the cores with little effort, just hold it like a screwdriver and pushing and rotating the zigzag sharp top into the apple. Fast and easy with no mess but the core. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: M Tung

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: We have a love hate relationship with our pear and apple trees. I love the fresh and home canned fruit. But, the process of processing the fruit, particularly in the large quantities you get with your own trees can be overwhelming. We've even ended up with a harvester's version of tennis elbow after a bumper crop. This device helps...well once you have a bit of practice anyway. It's not perfect and I'm sure those with lots of practice can do a better job with another device or simply a sharp knife. But, if you have room in your kitchen, this will be an excellent addition to your tool kit and will speed up the processing of fresh fruit.
customer_reviews.author: B Gates

customer_reviews.title: Not dull, easy to use, and durable!
customer_reviews.text: My son is addicted to apples, except he doesn't want us to cut them in slices. He eats the entire apple, minus what I can grab from him before he can eat it ( core and seeds). This product works extremely well and it was such a good small investment! The apple corer is not dull and it does not show any signs of breaking anytime soon. Now I can core the apple and not worry about my son swallowing seeds!
customer_reviews.author: Carrie Cupples

customer_reviews.title: Apple Corer - Great Item
customer_reviews.text: This is the item to have for a apple core device, and best of all - the price is right! quality (great), use (easy to handle) price (awesome)
customer_reviews.author: Ted Az

customer_reviews.title: WORKS LIKE A CHARM
customer_reviews.text: Nice and sturdy. Works well. We dehydrate a lot of apples for snacking, and this makes prepping the apples a breeze. Really glad we bought it.
customer_reviews.author: High Hopes

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Love this little gadget! I will never buy the other style of apple corer (with slicer around) ever again. I even use this on oranges because I don’t like the center.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Marie Scott

customer_reviews.title: fine for apples, but even better for taters, onions, etc.
customer_reviews.text: we use this routinely, but actually more for coring potatoes than apples. we core the taters and stuff them with meats and cheeses, and wrap them up to be grilled. works like a charm. you can do the same with onions, large carrots, etc. it really is pretty darned handy.
customer_reviews.author: michael

customer_reviews.title: For when you want a single apple.
customer_reviews.text: Need to aim a bit better to get the full core in one go, but still a helpful to when you don't want to pull a whole contraption out for specific recipes or a single apple.
customer_reviews.author: Eric C. Green

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: PERFECT little device. My son loves apples but he has autism and doesn’t understand that we don’t eat the core. So we’ve been struggling to get him to stop eating the stem and seeds and what not. This solved that problem!
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay Kaye

customer_reviews.title: Works Like The Old Ones Used To
customer_reviews.text: I hadn't found a decent apple corer that was inexpensive until I found this one. The other cheaply priced ones were made poorly. This works well. Still going strong after multiple seasons in the kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Ish Wish Dish

customer_reviews.title: A Great, Basic Tool for the Kitchen!
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice, basic tool for the aspiring baker. I've enjoyed baking with apples for a while, but didn't do it too awful much because cutting the cores out was a grind. This corer does exactly what it's supposed to, and washes out really easily when you're done by just being held under the sink. I would definitely recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This thing is S T U R D Y!
customer_reviews.text: Life is better with this tool. Come on ya'll! - you KNOW you need to be eating tasty apples! Rather than guess as to the locations of the seeds, why not take all the guess work out of the core - this tool does exactly that - quickly and with almost no effort- they you sit back and enjoy a healthy snack with ZERO stress.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian J. Rowe

customer_reviews.title: Quality sturdy product
customer_reviews.text: oxo never disappoints, they make quality user friendly products without all the extra crap you dont need, this product works amazing
customer_reviews.author: Lance P.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I love this! I’m using this to make apple “cookies”. It makes my life so much easier and is so easy to use! It feels sturdy and will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: kayla thiry

customer_reviews.title: Haven't tried this as yet but
customer_reviews.text: It looks easy to clean and use and it seems very sturdy. Sturdiness was a huge concern for me because of my arthritis so I'm anxious to try it out.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Usual OXO quality and thoughtful design
customer_reviews.text: It does the job well and has the traditional OXO quality and thoughtful design. Buy with confidence.
customer_reviews.author: IBuyTooMuchOnAmazon

customer_reviews.title: So .... where has this tool been all my life ???
customer_reviews.text: First cut flattening slice from bottom of apple or other fruit to ensure an accurate downward coring. Then the rest is easy. Otherwise accurate coring is hit and miss. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas A. Hasselbach

customer_reviews.title: Saw something like this on one of my favorite cooking channels and ...
customer_reviews.text: Saw something like this on one of my favorite cooking channels and I just had to get it. 1. Sturdy. Not flimsy at all 2. Nice handle for grabbing, it fits comfortably in the hand 3. Pretty damn sharp. 4. Cored my apple really nicely Cannot wait to use this in future projects, i.e. coring cupcakes so I can put in fillings.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Kim

customer_reviews.title: Core Values...
customer_reviews.text: This one is strong and sturdy and as the description says "Fruit core removes easily from corer head". OXO makes pretty good stuff; I have some other kitchen items of theirs. This seems like a pretty good apple corer and makes it easier to enjoy this delicious fruit, and is essential if you want to bake a few. The amazon reviews helped me decide on this purchase, glad I got it.
customer_reviews.author: KnightinTunisia

customer_reviews.title: Great for storage
customer_reviews.text: Where has this been all my life. So much easier to store than those awkward slicer ones. I’d rather use this and cut the apples how I like and save space in my drawer than the use those other kinds.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy grip
customer_reviews.text: Just what I was expecting. it has a great easy grip Handle. Very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Kbuzz

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool
customer_reviews.text: I really can't imagine anything being easier to use! I make homemade baby food and this tool has been very helpful. I've only used it on pears and apples so far, but it's worked great. It glides through the fruit with no issue whatsoever. It's large enough to accommodate a pear, but anything larger and you'd have to insert on both sides to completely remove the core.
customer_reviews.author: MysticPizzaTop Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: Apple Corer Really Works Well
customer_reviews.text: Received this apple corer last week and have tried it daily since. To my surprise, this corer really works well!!! Have no fear of cutting my hand with this corer. Easy to clean and sharp enough to cut through the apple and cleanly separates the core/seeds from the apple. I would recommend this to everyone. Worth every penny I spent.
customer_reviews.author: Marcia Shiraki

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Never disappointed with OXO Products. This one replaced a cheap one I had where the handle had came loose from the metal. The OXO handle is big and has a good feel on the grip. Not disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: B. Butler

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: This is my first apple corer and I think it works nicely - will probably work even better once I get the hang of it. It doesn't take much force to press it into the apple and because it's pretty thick - it usually gets all the core out in one go. Sometimes the apple is slightly crooked however, like in my video, which makes it a tad more difficult and you have to core it twice. To get the core out of the device I just press it hard with my finger and out it pops.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Simple, Effective
customer_reviews.text: My wife mocked the idea of an apple corer until I bought this one. It's incredibly easy to use. Zip it in once and take out most or all of the core. Look inside and you can use the tool to precisely remove any remaining core bits. It rinses right off. The reason I bought this thing is because I like to give my kid apples, but I don't want her eating the seeds (they contain arsenic).
customer_reviews.author: Nick777

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for potato bombs
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to core out potatoes. Works easy & keeps the cores in re-usable condition
customer_reviews.author: K. McClain

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic, Best I've ever bought.
customer_reviews.text: Such a great coring tool. Easy to hold, effortless to use because of the staggered teeth on the end and very easy to remove core and clean. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Donald F. Lessnau

customer_reviews.title: Good for apple rings not pie slices.
customer_reviews.text: Easier to cut the apple then to core it. Perhaps it I need apple rings it would be useful.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Corer
customer_reviews.text: I followed the recommendation of Cook's Illustrated in buying this. The corer is so much better than the half circle corer I used growing up. Solid handle is easy to grip and gives you enough torque that it feels almost effortless to use. The hardest part is aiming the thing so it goes through the center of the apple. Also the size of the core extract is a little on the small side for the biggest apples. A little of the core is left in the apple, but for normal store sized apples it works great. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Researcher

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!!
customer_reviews.text: Works get! We use this tool in the kitchen to make potato bombs! Core some russet potato's, stuff your favorites inside (relish, cheese, garlic spices, meat or what ever you can think of that tastes good), cut the core into two pieces and plug each side of the potato, roll up in foil and bake on the grill or in the oven! Cut in half when done and serve. Amazing!!
customer_reviews.author: smokey831

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Works as described, wanted something to core an apple but leave it whole with skin, this does the trick. Definitely need to be careful and mindful of what is underneath the apple.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Diameter a little small.
customer_reviews.text: Cuts great but the diameter is not large enough to remove the entire core in one cut. I usually use a knife to remove the remainder of the core.
customer_reviews.author: Robin R.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for coring apples. I don't know why I didn't buy this years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to core apples for VBS. We made Apple slice sandwiches filled with peanut butter. The children loved it.
customer_reviews.author: Pam willis

customer_reviews.title: Love it buy it already
customer_reviews.text: Omg this is a game changer , for you that says no I don't need this. YOU DO. Makes life so easy
customer_reviews.author: Vanlex

customer_reviews.title: OXO never disappoints
customer_reviews.text: Works just as expected - a fairly effective, sturdy yet sleek corer.
customer_reviews.author: MSN

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to core tomatoes before slicing for sandwich works great gets rid of hard core no one eats anyway
customer_reviews.author: Donald

customer_reviews.title: Nice grip
customer_reviews.text: I like the grip. These are hard to find in stores so I was happy to find one online to replace the one I had lost
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Apple Corer
customer_reviews.text: I guess this appliance is as good as most, but it really doesn't do what I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Rick M.

customer_reviews.title: Am I doing something wrong???
customer_reviews.text: When I attempt to core an apple the corer goes in fine but the core of the apple does not come out. Thus I need to get a knife and dig out the core. The video does not demonstrates how do use the core on a real apple. What am I doing wrong???
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Give it a wiggle to get through the skin, and then it pops right through the Apple and removes the core, easy, every time. This has saved me so much time.
customer_reviews.author: L K-S

customer_reviews.title: Great for coring apples!
customer_reviews.text: This is great for making "apple donuts" which is what my kids call apples that have the core removed. For some reason it really is extra enjoyable eating an apple when you do not have to worry about navigating the core. I purchased on before and it worked well but the metal piece collapsed after a few months. This one seems sturdier. I am very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: MommaCX3 ☀️❤️

customer_reviews.title: Very useful and functional
customer_reviews.text: Very useful and functional. One of the best tools out there to de-core an apple. The serrated end sliced through an apples core with great ease. After purchasing several kitchen tools that missed the broadside of a barn, I was happy to find that this hit the jackpot. I strongly recommend this product and am pleased with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Sayed I

customer_reviews.title: Love OXO products but...
customer_reviews.text: I have apples cored, sliced and stored in the fridge. Using this compared to a knife from my set, the apples turn brown where this touched the apple (unlike my paring knife). If you plan on coring and eating right away you're good to go. The apples I store do not go bad, just discolor.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Girard

customer_reviews.title: Great quality!
customer_reviews.text: Works as it should. Oxo is a brand I trust.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for baked apples!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, and great to have. Such an awesome thing especially if you want to make a baked apple.
customer_reviews.author: John wilhelm

customer_reviews.title: Diameter too small to remove whole core
customer_reviews.text: Tool is quite dull making it difficult to cut through apples. Should be larger diameter and sharper.
customer_reviews.author: Rollin

customer_reviews.title: Must have for your kitchen needs
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely perfect for my apples and it makes my job easier. It’s well made and priced right.
customer_reviews.author: Suzana

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Does the job! Love how easy it is to use.
customer_reviews.author: GuyC

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: Decent but it can take practice to get the full core out in one
customer_reviews.author: Kyler Kasper

customer_reviews.title: Great Apple corer
customer_reviews.text: Love OXO & thieir original Apple corer. Tried & true. Only brand I like because no strength in wrists and hands.
customer_reviews.author: Lives to read!

customer_reviews.title: Hard to grip, coring edge is not sharp, ...
customer_reviews.text: Hard to grip, coring edge is not sharp, hard to remove core. Still looking for a mechanical corer with a leverage device of some sort but which doesn't also peel.
customer_reviews.author: Engforglemmegei

customer_reviews.title: Great Kitchen Gadget!
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy with this purchase. Having a apple corer has been so helpful. My toddler likes to eat an apple whole, and by peeling and coring the apple, it makes it possible, Such a great little kitchen gadget!
customer_reviews.author: Teacher Mom

customer_reviews.title: Great product for coring
customer_reviews.text: Easy to grip corer, works wonderful, however the diameter of the cutter is too big for what I need it for, coring cupcakes.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Great Apple Core remover recommend
customer_reviews.text: Great Apple Core remover for the price strong and sturdy
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Markovich

customer_reviews.title: It’s okay
customer_reviews.text: The apple corer circumference is small, I kept finding seeds and core still in the apples.
customer_reviews.author: molly

customer_reviews.title: For the confused
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to say I just needed an applease corer and after researching one on here I had no idea what to get so many good and bad and mixed reviews. I just went with this one took my chances..it's great dishwasher safe has not warped or broke since summer. Glad I went with this one.
customer_reviews.author: jules1985

customer_reviews.title: It is surprisingly smooth and easy.
customer_reviews.text: I use this to core apples for my toddler who doesn't understand that he can't/shouldn't eat the core or the seeds of an apple. I have carpal tunnel issues in my hands, and I was worried if I would be able to push it through the apple, but I had no problems at all. It is surprisingly smooth and easy.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Tompkins

customer_reviews.title: It works as advertised! Good deal!
customer_reviews.text: Usually these kind of corers bend and twist. This one is very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Thacker

customer_reviews.title: Strong and durable
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and cleans and.cores apple very easily.love it
customer_reviews.author: Lisa godinez

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: Takes the core out of apples, as advertised. Could be sharper.h
customer_reviews.author: Hiker

customer_reviews.title: Great handy kitchen tool!
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with my new apple corer. It is easy to use. Glides right through the apple.
customer_reviews.author: Michele Rener

customer_reviews.title: Best apple corer I ever had
customer_reviews.text: This is a great solidly built apple/pear corer. It works really well and is very sturdy. It is easy to remove the cores from it after use. I am sure this will last for many years
customer_reviews.author: JohnP

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: I like to make Apple "chips" (dehydrate apples in the oven). While it's easy to just throw a few apples in the food processor/slicer; manually coring the apples with a knife was such a turn off. Now it's just a few twists of this corer and pop goes the core then into the processor, and finally, into the oven for my healthy snack. Exactly what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Good kitchen tool
customer_reviews.text: I had never used one of these before but found it easy to get used to and very handy. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Diddley Squat

customer_reviews.title: Great apple corer!
customer_reviews.text: I love this product so much! It removes the core easily (don't have to use too much force) and I love how much apple it saves (versus if I just cut around the core with a knife.) This has made making fresh juices a lot easier! I also have had fun coring apples and then cutting the apple into slivers, and making different kinds of apple sandwiches. Apple and cheddar sandwich, yum!
customer_reviews.author: ChrisRo

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I love to bake and autumn is one of my favorite seasons because of the fresh picked apples. I don't know how I survived this long without an apple corer. This product is really easy to use and I've already noticed a difference in the amount of time it takes me to prepare apples for my recipes. Would definitely recommend or buy as a gift for a friend/family members.
customer_reviews.author: La Reina

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: So much easier than the wedge cutters and less waste than cutting with a knife!
customer_reviews.author: Levi

customer_reviews.title: Works Like A Charm!
customer_reviews.text: I had a different kind of corer and always had a difficult time getting it through the apple. The OXO Good Grips Corer goes into the apple without any problem then goes straight through without heavy pushing by the user. A very worthwhile addition to my kitchen implements.
customer_reviews.author: L. Burr

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: This corer makes the job of coring apples and pears an easy job. It's easy to use and to clean. It is simple and well made. The size of the hole is fine for medium sized fruits. For a bigger fruit, after I core and slice it, I place the slices flat on the cutting board and use the corer to remove remaining core. Most important of all, my kids love eating more fruits when they are sliced into rings.
customer_reviews.author: polarbearpilot

customer_reviews.title: Best apple corer.
customer_reviews.text: This works better than other apple corers! I can’t be without this!
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: But its EXCELLENT at that one task
customer_reviews.text: Yes, its a unitasker. But its EXCELLENT at that one task. After ruining a bunch of apples for my bake apple dishes, I bought this and never look back. Coring and wedging apples is now quick and easy. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Eric L. Fletcher

customer_reviews.title: I hate unitasker but this does work good
customer_reviews.text: I hate unitasker but this does work good. Almost cutting my finger coring with a knife was enough of an excuse.
customer_reviews.author: DALW

customer_reviews.title: Best
customer_reviews.text: I bought a Kitchenaid corer and this OXO one and I prefer OXO. It goes right through.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer86

customer_reviews.title: Easy and helpful!!!
customer_reviews.text: I just used this to core an apple for my kids and it is amazing! It was so easy to push through the apple and pulled the core cleanly out of a gala apple. It was also very easy to clean and is dishwasher safe! I got a recipe on pinterest to make apple slice pancakes and now with this little gadget I will be able to try them out next weekend!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda J

customer_reviews.title: could be wider
customer_reviews.text: I really wish that this was wider because it doesn't get the whole core which is annoying
customer_reviews.author: Terry Sawyer

customer_reviews.title: Great, but wish it were sharper
customer_reviews.text: A great tool as are all OXO tools I've tried. I understand they cannot make it too sharp for safety reasons, but if it were just a little sharper it would be 5 stars. Being dull, it's safe, but requires too much pressure to push through an apple. Ironically, applying the extra pressure actually makes it less safe because it's not as stable when one has to push so hard.
customer_reviews.author: Operations Rick

customer_reviews.title: Everyone needs this
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly. Had been looking for this in stores for a while and happy to find on amazon
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and store
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. I have a favorite apple recipe that requires coring my apples. It’s simple and easy to use. It’s also not bulky and easy to store.
customer_reviews.author: SP

customer_reviews.title: Love this product.
customer_reviews.text: Makes it so easy to core apples or make potato bombs!!
customer_reviews.author: Tabitha

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This works really well. I have to twist a bit to get it going but it's turned snack time into a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Steph R

customer_reviews.title: Works fine.
customer_reviews.text: I like the handle. I have an old apple corer with a flimsy handle that I planned to replace. it does the job pretty well and is easy to clean afterwards. It doesn't quite get all the core leaving some seed pockets but you would lose a lot more apple if it cored a huge center section out.
customer_reviews.author: Ernie's mom

customer_reviews.title: Practical item
customer_reviews.text: Rather practical item to have. Easy to use and clean
customer_reviews.author: Jonas

product_meta.title: OXO Good Grips Apple Corer
product_meta.description:
With OXO?s Corer it is easy to make delicious baked apples and perfect apple rings. The stainless steel Corer glides easily though an apple or pear to remove the core cleanly, and the core is easily removed from the tool with a simple shake. A soft handle absorbs pressure so your hands don?t have to. Features of the Oxo Good Grips Corer include:Stainless steel headCore is easily removed from toolDishwasher safeWarranty Information Watch and see how easy it is to use!

AMAZON.COM
Round, perfect apple rings are simple with this corer by Oxo. With itsdurable stainless-steel head, it slices swiftly through fruit; just shake it to get the core out of the tool. Use it to make pristine baked apples and apple rings, or try it with pears. A soft, oversized, nonslip rubber handle absorbs the pressure the work puts on your hands. With a large hole for hanging, storage is easy. Cleanup is easy, as well--like all Oxo Good Grips tools, this is dishwasher-safe. --Laurie Notaro
feature_bullets: Comfortable nonslip handle, wet or dry
Fruit core removes easily from corer head
Corer head is stainless steel for easy cleaning and precise cut
Large handle hole for easy storage

The OXO Better Guarantee: If you experience an issue with your OXO product, get in touch with us to repair or replace it. We’re grateful for the opportunity to learn from your experience, and we’ll make it better.
